Recursion on Trees

CMPT 225

Recursion

Recursion: A definition of a function is recursive if the body cointains an application of itself.

Consider: S(n)=∑i=0ni S(n)=\sum_{i=0}^{n} i S(n)=i=0∑n​i

or

S(n)={0if n=0n+S(n−1)if n>0 S(n) = \begin{cases} 0 & \text{if } n=0\\ n+S(n-1) & \text{if } n>0 \end{cases} S(n)={0n+S(n−1)​if n=0if n>0​
